001package edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.adapter;
002
003import android.content.Context;
004import android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener;
005import android.view.LayoutInflater;
006import android.view.View;
007import android.view.ViewGroup;
008import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
009import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
010import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter;
011import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder;
012import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.databinding.ItemPatternListBinding;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.model.entity.Pattern;
014import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.viewmodel.PatternLibraryViewModel;
015import java.util.List;
016
017/**
018 * This {@link Adapter} is the joining element between the data and the view model. This class sends
019 * the {@link List} of {@code patterns} to the {@link PatternLibraryViewModel} and populates the
020 * layout with data
021 */
022public class PatternLibraryAdapter extends Adapter<ViewHolder> {
023
024  private final List<Pattern> patterns;
025  private final LayoutInflater inflater;
026  private final OnPatternClickListener listener;
027
028  /**
029   * This constructor initializes {@code patterns}, {@code inflater}, and {@code listener}
030   *
031   * @param context  {@link Context} is the global information from the activity that allows us to
032   *                 share information across multiple fragments
033   * @param patterns {@link List} of {@link Pattern} instances that the user has created and saved.
034   * @param listener {@link OnPatternClickListener} that listens for when a pattern in the
035   *                 {@link RecyclerView} is tapped and initiates whatever code is attached to it.
036   */
037  public PatternLibraryAdapter(Context context, List<Pattern> patterns,
038      OnPatternClickListener listener) {
039    this.patterns = patterns;
040    this.inflater = LayoutInflater.from(context);
041    this.listener = listener;
042  }
043
044  @NonNull
045  @Override
046  public ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull ViewGroup viewGroup, int i) {
047    ItemPatternListBinding binding = ItemPatternListBinding.inflate(inflater, viewGroup, false);
048    return new Holder(binding);
049  }
050
051  @Override
052  public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull ViewHolder viewHolder, int i) {
053    ((Holder) viewHolder).bind(i);
054  }
055
056  @Override
057  public int getItemCount() {
058    return patterns.size();
059  }
060
061  private class Holder extends ViewHolder {
062
063    private final ItemPatternListBinding binding;
064
065    private Holder(@NonNull ItemPatternListBinding binding) {
066      super(binding.getRoot());
067      this.binding = binding;
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * This code binds the view object and interactions with the view to the data.
072     *
073     * @param position This is the position of the pattern in the {@link RecyclerView}
074     */
075    void bind(int position) {
076      // If you have interactable stuff in your RecyclerView, the listeners go here.
077      Pattern pattern = patterns.get(position);
078//      binding.patternPicture.setImageURI();
079      binding.patternName.setText(pattern.getPatternName());
080      binding.patternSubtext.setText(pattern.getPatternDescription());
081      binding.getRoot()
082          .setOnClickListener((view) -> listener.onPatternClick(pattern, position, view));
083    }
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * This functional interface is an {@link OnClickListener} that allows me to listen for when a
088   * {@code pattern} is clicked in the {@link RecyclerView}.
089   */
090  @FunctionalInterface
091  public interface OnPatternClickListener {
092
093    /**
094     * This method is the key to keeping this interface a functional interface, so I can use it in
095     * the {@link Holder#bind(int) bind} method above.
096     *
097     * @param pattern  The instance of {@link Pattern}  the user selected from the
098     *                 {@link RecyclerView}.
099     * @param position The position of the selected {@code pattern} in the {@link RecyclerView}.
100     * @param view     The {@link View} object that holds the {@link RecyclerView}.
101     */
102    void onPatternClick(Pattern pattern, int position, View view);
103
104  }
105
106}
